Password Protect Your Sites

Dec 18, 2016
Note: a Pro membership is required for password protection.

You asked, we listened!

A few members have asked for the ability to password protect the sites they’ve created on updog.co, and now all Pro members can!

When you create a site on updog.co, your site is only accessible to those with whom you share the URL. In some cases, you might want to allow others to see your site for a limited time.

How to password protect your site

Click “Settings” for any one of your sites, and scroll down to the Passcode section.

This input will always be empty. Importantly, UpDog does not store your password in plaintext form. That is, once you set a passcode on one of your sites, you will not be able to retrieve the password - be sure to remember it!

How to view your protected site

I created this demo for you to see how passcode protection works.

The passcode is passcodedemo

Questions?

Feel free to leave a comment below or contact us.
